intro: Woodburnia, commonly known as the flame flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Woodburnia species typically have opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
